text: Jacqueline Scott (January 1, 1932 - July 23, 2020) was an American actress who appeared frequently in movies and television throughout the 1950s through 1980s. She was called "The Youngest Old-Timer in the Business" because she appeared opposite several of the most well-known male actors of her day. She was featured in such major sitcoms as The Twilight Zone, Gunsmoke, The Fugitive, and Perry Mason. Smith died on July 23, 2020 in Los Angeles, aged 89. ==References== Category:1932 births Category:2020 deaths Category:American movie actors Category:American television actors Category:American stage actors Category:Actors from Missouri
title: Jacqueline Scott
